patch.summary: Update a vulnerability of a project

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: Filter vulnerabilities by branch names. Only vulnerabilities from these branches will be counted. Use GET /project/:projectId/branches to get available branches. Can be passed as comma-separated string or multiple query params.

get.summary: Get overview of a project

get.description: Returns comprehensive vulnerability statistics aggregated across all projects in the organization. Supports filtering by projects, teams, severity, status, analysis types, date ranges, languages, branches, and more. Includes pagination for summaries and period-over-period comparison.

parameters.name: severityFilter
parameters.description: Filter vulnerabilities by severity levels. Only vulnerabilities matching these severities will be counted in all statistics.

parameters.name: statusFilter
parameters.description: Filter vulnerabilities by status. Affects all counts and statistics.

parameters.name: analysisTypes
parameters.description: Filter vulnerabilities by analysis type (security scanner category).

parameters.name: includeResolved
parameters.description: Include resolved/closed vulnerabilities in all counts. Default: false (only open vulnerabilities).

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: Start date for filtering vulnerabilities by creation date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: End date for filtering vulnerabilities by creation date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: branches
parameters.description: Filter vulnerabilities by branch names (comma-separated). Only vulnerabilities from these branches will be included in all statistics.

parameters.name: teamIds
parameters.description: Filter data to specific teams by their IDs. Only projects belonging to these teams will be included.

parameters.name: trendPeriodDays
parameters.description: Number of days for trend calculation. Affects new/resolved issue counts.

parameters.name: comparisonPeriod
parameters.description: Comparison period for period-over-period analysis. Enables severityComparison and totalComparison in response.

parameters.name: projectsPage
parameters.description: Page number for projects summary pagination.

parameters.name: projectsPageSize
parameters.description: Number of projects per page in projectsSummary.

parameters.name: teamsPage
parameters.description: Page number for teams summary pagination.

parameters.name: teamsPageSize
parameters.description: Number of teams per page in teamsSummary.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort field for projects and teams summaries. Applied to both lists.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sort direction for projects and teams summaries. DESC = highest first.

parameters.name: includeProjectsSummary
parameters.description: Include projectsSummary array in response. Disable for faster, smaller response.

parameters.name: includeTeamsSummary
parameters.description: Include teamsSummary array in response. Disable for faster, smaller response.

parameters.name: includeOverTimeData
parameters.description: Include vulnerabilitiesOverTime array for timeline charts. Disable if not needed.

parameters.name: topVulnerableLimit
parameters.description: Limit for topVulnerableProjects array. Returns N most vulnerable projects.

get.summary: Get aggregated overview statistics for an organization

404.description: Image not found for this project.

post.description: Creates a link between a GitHub repository and a CybeDefend project for automated scanning. Once linked, the project will receive webhook events from the repository for automated security scans.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization that owns the project

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to link with the GitHub repository

400.description: Invalid request parameters or repository already linked

401.description: Authentication token is missing or invalid

delete.description: Removes the link between a GitHub repository and a CybeDefend project. This will stop webhook events and automated scans for this repository.

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the organization that owns the project

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the project to unlink from the GitHub repository

400.description: Invalid request parameters or repository not linked

401.description: Authentication token is missing or invalid

info.title: Cybedefend API
info.description: CybeDefend is an advanced API for application security analysis. Based on a microservices architecture using TypeScript and the NestJS framework, it communicates via Kafka to ensure cooperation between services. Key features include OAuth 2.0 authentication, user/organization/project management, and REBAC-based permissions. It excels in static, dynamic, and IaC security analyses (SAST, DAST, IaC, etc.) by integrating various open source tools.

teamAssignments.description: Array of team assignments with roles for automatic addition upon invitation acceptance

service.description: Name of the service where the error occurred

method.description: Method name where the error occurred

organizationId.description: Unique identifier of the created organization

ingestionProjectId.description: Ingestion project identifier for parsed projects

isGithubLinked.description: Indicates if the project is linked to a GitHub repository

isGitlabLinked.description: Indicates if the project is linked to a GitLab repository

highRiskProjectsInLast7Days.description: Number of high risk projects in the last 7 days

solvedIssuesInLast7Days.description: Number of solved issues in the last 7 days

newIssuesInLast7Days.description: Number of new issues in the last 7 days

projects.description: List of projects with all informations

agentCategoriesSast.description: Active SAST agent vulnerability categories (internal names)

agentCategoriesIac.description: Active IAC agent vulnerability categories (internal names)

issueCreationBranches.description: List of branches for which issues should be created. Empty means all branches.

githubIssueEnabled.description: Enable GitHub issue creation for vulnerabilities

gitlabIssueEnabled.description: Enable GitLab issue creation for vulnerabilities

issueCreationMode.description: Issue creation mode: per_vulnerability (SCA only), per_vulnerability_type, per_file

issueCreationBranches.description: List of branches for which issues should be created. Empty array or undefined means all branches.

agentCategoriesSast.description: Active SAST agent vulnerability categories (full replacement list of internal names)

agentCategoriesIac.description: Active IAC agent vulnerability categories (full replacement list of internal names)

githubIssueEnabled.description: Enable GitHub issue creation for vulnerabilities

gitlabIssueEnabled.description: Enable GitLab issue creation for vulnerabilities

issueCreationMode.description: Issue creation mode: per_vulnerability (SCA only), per_vulnerability_type, per_file

issueCreationBranches.description: List of branches for which issues should be created. Empty array clears the setting (all branches).

success.description: Indicates if the update was successful

message.description: Message describing the result of the update
Message describing the result of project deletion

prUrl.description: Pull / Merge Request URL if success

vulnerabilityIds.description: List of vulnerability identifiers (UUIDs) to fix in batch

branchName.description: Optional custom branch name for the fix (auto-generated if not provided)

contextLines.description: Number of context lines to include above/below each vulnerability (default: 20)

reason.description: Reason code if skipped or error

filePath.description: File path where the vulnerability was found

prUrl.description: Pull / Merge Request URL if created

message.example: Batch AutoFix completed: 3 fixed, 1 skipped, 0 errors

branch.description: Git branch name created for the fixes

errorCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities that failed to fix

branch.description: Git branch name for branch-specific conversations. Used together with projectId to identify the project context in Potpie. Defaults to "main" if not provided.

vulnerabilityId.description: Optional vulnerability identifier (UUID). If provided, the conversation will start focused on this vulnerability context.

initialMessage.description: Optional initial user message to send
initialMessage.example: List the critical vulnerabilities related to authentication.

message.description: Message describing the result of deletion

role.description: Role to assign to the member

success.description: Indicates if the removal was successful

role.description: Role to assign to the member

success.description: Indicates if role update was successful

language.description: Array of detected or target languages

private.description: Define if the scan is private

initializerUserId.description: User ID who initialized the scan

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the scan

startTime.description: Date and time when the scan started

endTime.description: Date and time when the scan ended

containers.description: Array of containers used or involved in this scan

progress.description: Progress of the scan in percentage (0-100)

errorCode.description: Exit code from the scanner (see scanlink-error-codes.ts for reference)

errorCategory.description: Error category: authentication, cloud_provider, network, scan, api, unknown

totalVulnerabilities.description: Total number of vulnerabilities identified so far

processedVulnerabilities.description: Number of vulnerabilities processed so far

branch.description: Branch name being scanned (for GitHub/GitLab integrations). If not provided, scan is not associated with a specific branch.

sourceType.description: Source type of the scan (manual, cli, github, gitlab, jetbrains, vscode). Defaults to manual if not provided.

message.description: Message describing the scan start result

scanId.description: The unique identifier of the created scan

detectedLanguages.description: Detected languages (if any) during scan initialization

credentialId.description: Credential ID to use for authentication (preferred over username/password)

username.description: Registry username or token name (not required if credentialId is provided)

password.description: Registry password or token (not required if credentialId is provided)

awsAccessKeyId.description: AWS Access Key ID (required for ECR)

awsSecretAccessKey.description: AWS Secret Access Key (required for ECR)

gcpServiceAccountKey.description: GCP Service Account Key (base64 encoded JSON, required for GCR)

vulnerabilityTypes.description: Types of vulnerabilities to look for.

registryAuth.description: Registry authentication for private registries. If not provided, public registry is assumed.

sourceType.description: Source type of the scan (manual, cli, github, gitlab). Defaults to manual if not provided.

projectId.description: CybeDefend project ID to associate this credential with

password.description: JFrog password or API key/identity token

credentialId.description: Credential ID to use for authentication

imageName.description: Image name with tag to scan (e.g., my-app:v1.0.0)

privateScan.description: Whether the scan results should be private

vulnerableStartLine.description: Line number where the vulnerability starts

vulnerableEndLine.description: Line number where the vulnerability ends

code.description: Lines of code in the snippet

line.description: Line number where the element is found

code.description: Lines of code surrounding the dataflow item

language.description: Programming language for this code snippet

type.description: Type of data flow step (e.g. source, sink)

order.description: Order of this item in the dataflow sequence

codeSnippet.description: Code snippet related to the vulnerability

dataFlow.description: Data flow steps leading to the vulnerability

runningDockerImageVersion.description: Version of the Docker image used for scanning

startedAt.description: Date and time when the scan started

finishedAt.description: Date and time when the scan finished

isLastRequest.description: Indicates if this is the last request for this scan

vulnerabilityType.description: Type of the vulnerability (e.g., sast, sca, etc.)

file.description: File where the library is declared

dependencyInfoAvailable.description: Indicates if dependency info (isDev/isTransitive) is available from the scanner

isLastRequest.description: Indicates if this is the last SCA request

packages.description: List of discovered packages or libraries

totalImages.description: Total number of images in the project

id.description: Unique identifier of the detected package

fileName.description: File name where the package was detected

createdAt.description: Date when the record was created

updatedAt.description: Date when the record was updated

createAt.description: Date when the scan was created

vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerabilities matching the filters

scanProjectInfo.description: Information about the ongoing or last scan

vulnCountByType.description: Count of vulnerabilities grouped by type (SAST, SCA, IaC)

vulnerability.description: Vulnerability object with a discriminator for SAST, IAC, or SCA

userId.description: User unique identifier that updates the vulnerability

count.description: Number of vulnerabilities for the given severity
Number of vulnerabilities for the given state

analysisType.description: Type of analysis (SAST, IAC, SCA, etc.)

count.description: Number of vulnerabilities for the given analysis type

severity.description: Number of vulnerabilities for the given date

count.description: Number of vulnerabilities for the given date

totalBySeverity.description: Aggregation of vulnerabilities grouped by severity

totalByState.description: Aggregation of vulnerabilities grouped by state

totalByAnalysisType.description: Aggregation of vulnerabilities grouped by analysis type

vulnerabilitiesOverTime.description: Number of vulnerabilities over time grouped by severity

riskLevel.description: Risk level of the project (critical, high, medium, low)

totalVulnerabilities.description: Total number of vulnerabilities in the project

projectCount.description: Number of projects in the team

totalVulnerabilities.description: Total number of vulnerabilities in the team

totalProjects.description: Total number of projects in the organization

totalTeams.description: Total number of teams in the organization

totalBySeverity.description: Aggregation of vulnerabilities grouped by severity

totalByState.description: Aggregation of vulnerabilities grouped by state

totalByAnalysisType.description: Aggregation of vulnerabilities grouped by analysis type

vulnerabilitiesOverTime.description: Vulnerabilities over time grouped by severity

highRiskProjects.description: Number of projects with critical or high risk level

mediumRiskProjects.description: Number of projects with medium risk level

lowRiskProjects.description: Number of projects with low or no risk level

newIssuesLast7Days.description: Number of new issues discovered in the last 7 days

solvedIssuesLast7Days.description: Number of issues resolved in the last 7 days

newIssues.description: Total number of new issues (all time)

criticalIssues.description: Total number of critical severity issues

highIssues.description: Total number of high severity issues

mediumIssues.description: Total number of medium severity issues

lowIssues.description: Total number of low severity issues

sbomJson.description: The complete SBOM JSON report as a string

sbomZip.description: The SBOM JSON report compressed with zlib deflate and encoded in base64

format.description: SBOM format (e.g., cyclonedx, spdx, syft-json, custom)

projectIds.description: List of project IDs to include in the report

detailed.description: Generate detailed report with full vulnerability descriptions

branches.description: List of distinct branch names found in SAST, SCA, and IAC vulnerability detections

totalOccurrences.description: Total number of occurrences across all groups

vulnerabilityIds.description: Array of SCA vulnerability detection IDs to analyze

updateLevel.description: Maximum update level allowed: patch, minor, major, or auto (auto-escalates from patch to major)

singleFix.description: If true, stop at first valid fix found (faster). If false, find all possible fixes.

createPr.description: If true, create a Pull Request with the fixes. Requires project to be linked to GitHub/GitLab.

targetBranch.description: Target branch name for the PR. If not specified, uses the default branch.

parentPackage.description: Parent package to update (the direct dependency)

fixedChildVersion.description: Version of child after parent upgrade (null if removed from tree)

updateType.description: Type of update: patch, minor, or major

isValid.description: Whether this fix actually resolves the vulnerability

vulnerabilityId.description: Database ID of the SCA vulnerability detection

dependencyPath.description: Path from root to vulnerable package (e.g., ["mkdirp@0.5.1", "minimist@0.0.8"])

ecosystem.description: Package ecosystem: npm, maven, pip, etc.

isTransitive.description: Whether this is a transitive dependency

recommendedFix.description: Best fix (most conservative: patch > minor > major)

status.description: Analysis status: ok, no_fix, error, or direct_update

installCommand.description: Command to apply the fix (e.g., "npm install mkdirp@0.5.5")

success.description: True if at least one vulnerability has a fix

status.description: Overall status: ok, partial, no_fix, or error

message.example: Found fixes for 3 out of 5 vulnerabilities

fixableCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities with fixes available

errorCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities that failed analysis

jobId.description: Job ID for polling status (only set when status is "queued" or "processing")

totalVulnerabilities.description: Total number of vulnerabilities to analyze

processedVulnerabilities.description: Number of vulnerabilities processed so far

fixableCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities with fixes found

errorCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities that failed analysis

error.description: Error message if PR creation failed

message.example: Found fixes for 3 out of 5 vulnerabilities

fixableCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities with fixes available

errorCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities that failed analysis

myTeams.description: List of teams within the organization

isOnboardingCompleted.description: Indicates if the onboarding is completed

myOrganizations.description: List of organizations the user is part of

notification.description: Enable or disable notifications for the user

scanBranch.description: Branch to scan (defaults to repository default branch if not specified)

code.description: Authorization code returned by GitHub OAuth

branch.description: Branch to scan (defaults to configured scan branch or repository default branch)

state.description: OAuth state parameter for CSRF protection

scanBranch.description: Branch to scan (defaults to repository default branch if not specified)

branch.description: Branch to scan (defaults to configured scan branch or repository default branch)

userId.description: User who installed the GitHub App

total.description: Total number of container registry credentials

github.description: GitHub App installation details (null if not installed)

gitlab.description: GitLab integration details (null if not connected)
